sinks.name: TEE_AllocateTransientObject
sinks.reason: Potential for memory corruption if the object type is derived from tainted data.

sinks.name: TEE_AllocateTransientObject
sinks.reason: Potential for memory corruption if the attributes are derived from tainted data.

sinks.name: TEE_CheckMemoryAccessRights
sinks.reason: Tainted memory address could lead to unauthorized access if not properly validated.

sinks.name: TEE_CipherDoFinal
sinks.reason: Output buffer could be tainted, leading to unencrypted data being written to shared memory.

sinks.name: TEE_CipherDoFinal
sinks.reason: Size parameter could be manipulated, leading to buffer overflows or out-of-bounds access.

sinks.name: TEE_CipherInit
sinks.reason: Missing input validation for cipher algorithm

sinks.name: TEE_Free
sinks.reason: Missing validation on pointer could lead to freeing invalid or tainted memory

sinks.name: TEE_FreeTransientObject
sinks.reason: If the handle is tainted, it could lead to freeing an invalid or unintended memory location, resulting in memory corruption or undefined behavior.

sinks.name: TEE_Malloc
sinks.reason: Size parameter can be tainted, leading to buffer overflows or out-of-bounds access.

sinks.name: TEE_PopulateTransientObject
sinks.reason: Potential for buffer overflow if size is manipulated

sinks.name: TEE_PopulateTransientObject
sinks.reason: Tainted data could lead to security issues when populating the transient object

sinks.name: TEE_SetOperationKey
sinks.reason: Potential for buffer overflow if the key parameter is not validated properly.

sinks.name: TEE_SetOperationKey
sinks.reason: Potential for buffer overflow if the key size parameter is manipulated, leading to memory corruption.

sinks.name: memset
sinks.reason: Destination pointer could be tainted, leading to memory corruption.

sinks.name: memset
sinks.reason: Size parameter could be tainted, leading to buffer overflow or out-of-bounds access.
